1: <sup>1</sup> I will sing of the mercies of the LORD for ever: with my mouth will I make known thy faithfulness to all generations.
2: <sup>2</sup> For I have said, Mercy shall be built up for ever: thy faithfulness shalt thou establish in the very heavens.
3: <sup>3</sup> I have made a covenant with my chosen, I have sworn unto David my servant,
4: <sup>4</sup> Thy seed will I establish for ever, and build up thy throne to all generations. Selah.
5: <sup>5</sup> And the heavens shall praise thy wonders, O LORD: thy faithfulness also in the congregation of the saints.
6: <sup>6</sup> For who in the heaven can be compared unto the LORD? who among the sons of the mighty can be likened unto the LORD?
7: <sup>7</sup> God is greatly to be feared in the assembly of the saints, and to be had in reverence of all them that are about him.
8: <sup>8</sup> O LORD God of hosts, who is a strong LORD like unto thee? or to thy faithfulness round about thee?
9: <sup>9</sup> Thou rulest the raging of the sea: when the waves thereof arise, thou stillest them.
10: <sup>10</sup> Thou hast broken Rahab in pieces, as one that is slain; thou hast scattered thine enemies with thy strong arm.
11: <sup>11</sup> The heavens are thine, the earth also is thine: as for the world and the fulness thereof, thou hast founded them.
12: <sup>12</sup> The north and the south thou hast created them: Tabor and Hermon shall rejoice in thy name.
13: <sup>13</sup> Thou hast a mighty arm: strong is thy hand, and high is thy right hand.
14: <sup>14</sup> Justice and judgment are the habitation of thy throne: mercy and truth shall go before thy face.
15: <sup>15</sup> Blessed is the people that know the joyful sound: they shall walk, O LORD, in the light of thy countenance.
16: <sup>16</sup> In thy name shall they rejoice all the day: and in thy righteousness shall they be exalted.
17: <sup>17</sup> For thou art the glory of their strength: and in thy favour our horn shall be exalted.
18: <sup>18</sup> For the LORD is our defence; and the Holy One of Israel is our king.
19: <sup>19</sup> Then thou spakest in vision to thy holy one, and saidst, I have laid help upon one that is mighty; I have exalted one chosen out of the people.
20: <sup>20</sup> I have found David my servant; with my holy oil have I anointed him:
21: <sup>21</sup> With whom my hand shall be established: mine arm also shall strengthen him.
22: <sup>22</sup> The enemy shall not exact upon him; nor the son of wickedness afflict him.
23: <sup>23</sup> And I will beat down his foes before his face, and plague them that hate him.
24: <sup>24</sup> But my faithfulness and my mercy shall be with him: and in my name shall his horn be exalted.
25: <sup>25</sup> I will set his hand also in the sea, and his right hand in the rivers.
26: <sup>26</sup> He shall cry unto me, Thou art my father, my God, and the rock of my salvation.
27: <sup>27</sup> Also I will make him my firstborn, higher than the kings of the earth.
28: <sup>28</sup> My mercy will I keep for him for evermore, and my covenant shall stand fast with him.
29: <sup>29</sup> His seed also will I make to endure for ever, and his throne as the days of heaven.
30: <sup>30</sup> If his children forsake my law, and walk not in my judgments;
31: <sup>31</sup> If they break my statutes, and keep not my commandments;
32: <sup>32</sup> Then will I visit their transgression with the rod, and their iniquity with stripes.
33: <sup>33</sup> Nevertheless my lovingkindness will I not utterly take from him, nor suffer my faithfulness to fail.
34: <sup>34</sup> My covenant will I not break, nor alter the thing that is gone out of my lips.
35: <sup>35</sup> Once have I sworn by my holiness that I will not lie unto David.
36: <sup>36</sup> His seed shall endure for ever, and his throne as the sun before me.
37: <sup>37</sup> It shall be established for ever as the moon, and as a faithful witness in heaven. Selah.
38: <sup>38</sup> But thou hast cast off and abhorred, thou hast been wroth with thine anointed.
39: <sup>39</sup> Thou hast made void the covenant of thy servant: thou hast profaned his crown by casting it to the ground.
40: <sup>40</sup> Thou hast broken down all his hedges; thou hast brought his strong holds to ruin.
41: <sup>41</sup> All that pass by the way spoil him: he is a reproach to his neighbours.
42: <sup>42</sup> Thou hast set up the right hand of his adversaries; thou hast made all his enemies to rejoice.
43: <sup>43</sup> Thou hast also turned the edge of his sword, and hast not made him to stand in the battle.
44: <sup>44</sup> Thou hast made his glory to cease, and cast his throne down to the ground.
45: <sup>45</sup> The days of his youth hast thou shortened: thou hast covered him with shame. Selah.
46: <sup>46</sup> How long, LORD? wilt thou hide thyself for ever? shall thy wrath burn like fire?
47: <sup>47</sup> Remember how short my time is: wherefore hast thou made all men in vain?
48: <sup>48</sup> What man is he that liveth, and shall not see death? shall he deliver his soul from the hand of the grave? Selah.
49: <sup>49</sup> Lord, where are thy former lovingkindnesses, which thou swarest unto David in thy truth?
50: <sup>50</sup> Remember, Lord, the reproach of thy servants; how I do bear in my bosom the reproach of all the mighty people;
51: <sup>51</sup> Wherewith thine enemies have reproached, O LORD; wherewith they have reproached the footsteps of thine anointed.
52: <sup>52</sup> Blessed be the LORD for evermore. Amen, and Amen.
